pullrequest.title: Upgrade Windows dependencies for Gazebo and build support

content.raw:
seems like the problem was indeed the mix of vcpkg/tarball headers for qt and we have the first succesfull builds, yay!

* gazebo 9.5.0 

    ![](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=gazebo-ci-pr_any-windows7-amd64&build=2428)

    [https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/gazebo-ci-pr\_any-windows7-amd64/2428/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-windows7-amd64/2428/))


* gazebo9 branch

    ![](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=gazebo-ci-pr_any-windows7-amd64&build=2430)

    [https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr\_any-windows7-amd64/2430/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-windows7-amd64/2430/))



Sean thanks for the patches, really appreciated. I will take care of send the corresponding PRs to Gazebo. A good next step would be to fix compilations problems in the test suite \(not compiled at this moment\).
content.html:
seems like the problem was indeed the mix of vcpkg/tarball headers for qt and we have the first succesfull builds, yay!

  • gazebo 9.5.0

    https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-windows7-amd64/2428/)

  • gazebo9 branch

    https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-windows7-amd64/2430/)

Sean thanks for the patches, really appreciated. I will take care of send the corresponding PRs to Gazebo. A good next step would be to fix compilations problems in the test suite (not compiled at this moment).
